comment: Worst class I've ever taken! Zero support. Lazy professor. A lot of the materials that are used for the online format are old and don't correspond with the book, quizzes or tests. Your best bet is to study the activities in Connect and previous quizzes though sometimes you may still not see any of the same content. DO NOT take this class.

I made an A in this class with a lot of hard work. You WILL NEED the book. For studying for tests, I recommend reading the chapter multiple times. He is a good professor and is very straight to the point. Teaches what you need to know and the stuff you'll see on the ACS final.

My only problem with him is that has health issues or something because at one point he was absent from class for about 2 weeks and so we had another Chem 1152 professor teach us, when Shugart came back what the other professor had taught us was not on the test. Also, the final is standardized, 50% of the test was not taught in that class at all.

He is horrible, lectures has nothing to do with the book. Every test we take has errors  and he is not willing to give credit .the final is standardized , it has materials we've never  covered . just avoid

Shugart is very sarcastic and can come across as blunt, but overall he is an excellent professor. He is straight to the point and doesn't teach things you don't need to know. I made it through the class without a book by studying lecture notes and made 2 A's and a B on his tests. I would recommend him over other chemistry professors!

Do not ask him what will be on the test.  I watched him chew and spit out students that did that. I was expecting a D  but sampling homework helped bump me up to a C.  I still have to retake though.  The class is hard no matter who you take.  I recommend taking during full semesters and not during summer. Study the book/PowerPoint
AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! He is the WORST professor I've ever experienced. He makes it impossible to make an A and is ZERO help. AVOID!

He is a horrible , rude, very sarcastic professor. He  wants you to take things for granted. Doesn't like to be asked. if you need help , don't even bother to ask him , instead of helping he will make fun of you. And even when he makes mistakes, he cannot admit that and will tell you that the book is wrong , other professors are wrong. stay away

Dr. Shugart's lectures and tests are aligned with the text, which was very helpful. He was always willing to do extra examples in class to make sure everyone comprehended.  But he can get frustrated with students and get snippy. I appreciate his NOT scheduling lectures on exam days. I liked Dr. Shugart, he is an effective and efficient professor.

Dr. Shugart is awesome! Do the work, prepare for lab, don't act like an idiot and you will do fine. He is super funny and understanding. If you have an issue with anything just talk to him and he will help you as much as possible. Definitely take.
I had him for lab and I really liked him. He is a smart ass sometimes, but only when people ask stupid questions or arent on top of their stuff. He was a good lab professor. Take him if you can.

Omg, I loved Dr. Shugart!! He was a lot of fun, and made the class very interesting (like explaining how to get rid of the smell of rotting corpses, lol). Unfortunately, the tests were really hard, and make sure you do the homework, otherwise you'll be totally lost!!

Best professor I have had here at KSU. Extremely understanding and lenient with grading and turning in reports. Very sweet and absolutely hilarious. If your professor for lecture is difficult, go to him and he will try to help you understand the material. TAKE HIM! Easy, kind, and has a very sarcastic humor that helps especially for an 8am class.

Smart, young, and very helpful. His exams are easy considering the subject matter. Straight to the point and very understandable. HW is online, drops lowest test grade of the semester. Highly recommend him. You have to study, not an easy A type of class. If youre lazy you wont do well.

I had him for both Class and Lab. He is awesome. Very considerate. This is a hard class and you must have to read and do extra work on ur own. He gives good direction and helps if you need help. He is funny; makes the class interesting. I had registered for this class before he was assigned to it. others dropped but some of stayed on. am glad i did

He is a really funny teacher. Dr. Shugart makes organic chemistry enjoyable and fun. I wish I had been able to take him for Ochem 1, but he didn't teach it when I took it. I definitely recommend him. He is a little different in his teaching style but all around awesome at teaching.

Made an A in chem 1. but then took his class and made a C. this teacher is unreasonable. he messed up my test and gave me 10 points lower than i should have received. but didnt think it was necessary to fix. He was a hard teacher and Im fine with a challenge. But if possible avoid this teacher.

He gave very good lectures try don't miss any. I was thinking he is very hard to approach . I got on final 76 it was extremely hard, when I count my grade I supposed to have 87 but I end up with "A". I don't think he even did the calculation. It not an easy class - that why everyone made one grade higher they supposed to have. He is something!

I like Chem. before his class, now I very exhausted . Study very hard, but very hard to get "A" in his class.  He is makes a lot of mistakes in homework,and tests- you have to fight for your points. Average of class test 64-66 but he is not gonna curve it-is not his rule.  Good lectures though, not easy class.

He is a good teacher and will explain everything in good detail because he does read the textbook. IT IS A HARD CLASS. You definitely need to read the book, but thats for any chemistry class. You can ask questions but sometimes he won't completely answer your question.
I had him for lab and he is great! Explains things well and is enthusiastic. He grades the labs very leniently and is not nit-picky. If you get on his good side and are interested he will like you!
Try to avoid him, not helpful at all and i've had better chem teachers.
Chemistry is generally a hard subject for many students. I feel like he did a good job in trying to help us understand the topic. His tests were medium level, not too hard, but not easy either.

I thought he was a great teacher and extremely knowledgeable. Chemistry is a tough class in itself and after taking it in high school, I thought Dr. Shugart did a great job. If you ever need any extra help he is glad to help and is very passionate about chemistry. The tests weren't that bad as long as you put some work in. Don't expect an easy A.

He is completely ridiculous. I have not been able to learn a single thing from him this semester. He doesn't teach, he just reads from the ppt. He really can't spell,which is annoying. He presents extremely easy examples during class, but then uses really complex examples that you've never done before on the tests. Really poor teacher.
